meanings.definition: A group of people working together on a project or task.
meanings.sent1: In our class, we formed a workgroup to complete the science project.
meanings.sent2: The workgroup at the office collaborated efficiently to finish the report.
meanings.sent3: The workgroup of friends decided to bake a cake together for fun.
meanings.sent4: The workgroup of ants diligently carried food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The workgroup of students brainstormed ideas for the school play.

meanings.definition: A group of computers connected to each other to share resources and information.
meanings.sent1: The IT department set up a workgroup for the office computers to share files.
meanings.sent2: The workgroup of laptops in the library allows students to access the same printer.
meanings.sent3: The workgroup of devices had a virtual party to celebrate their successful data transfer.
meanings.sent4: The workgroup of servers functioned like a well-oiled machine, ensuring smooth data flow.
meanings.sent5: The workgroup of computers communicated seamlessly to complete the network setup.
